description: Mainland Chinese remain unlikely - and unable - to come in droves given their own border restrictions. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Japan primed for tourism windfall, but without big-spending Chinese
title_page: Japan primed for tourism windfall, but without big-spending Chinese | The Straits Times
maintext:
TOKYO - Japan is primed for a tourism windfall from pent-up demand overseas as, for the first time in 2Â½ years, it throws open its borders to visa-free individual travellers from Oct 11.
The decisive measure, announced by Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in New York on Thursday, comes after months of baby steps that have proven to be head-scratching and cumbersome for potential visitors.
